text: Kleksography is the art of making images of various figures from inkblots. Justinus Kerner was the first who included kleksography in the book of poetry. Victor Hugo and George Sand used inkblots in their manuscripts. Since 1890, kleksography was used as the tool for work of unconsciousness. The most popular example is Rorschach test. == Related pages == * Rorschach test == References == Category:Paper Category:Art
title: Kleksography
